College: AVS Ayurveda Mahavidyalaya, Bijapur
Eligiblity:
Students seeking admission to the first year BAMS degree must have passed the two year PUC examination of the PUC Board, Bangalore or any other examination considered equivalent there to by Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences, Bangalore, with Physics, Chemistry and Biology as optional and with a practical examination in each subject with minimum 50% marks in these subjects.
A candidate who has passed the Pre-professional examination in Medicine conducted by any other recognized university shall also be eligible for admission. Subjects studied in the occasional course The graduate with Chemistry, Botany and Zoology is eligible for admission provided he/she produces a certificate of having passed an examination in Physics, the syllabus of which is equivalent to that of the two year Pre- University Course in In the case of a candidate who has taken Zoology and Botany as separate subjects, the marks in those subjects at the degree level will be considered as Biology marks.
A candidate who fulfils any one of the above requirements must have obtained not less than 50% marks in aggregate in the science subjects (Physics, Chemistry and Biology) at the qualifying examination or at a higher (University) examination.
No candidate shall be admitted unless he/she has completed 17 years of age as on 31st Dec. of the year of admission. Students who have passed an examination other than Pre - University, (Bangalore), should submit Eligibility Certificate before admission issued by the Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences, Bangalore
Course_Detail: Institution offers Bachelor of Ayurveda in Medicine and Surgery (B A M S) course of 5 and 1/2 duration which includes 3 phases of one and half year and one year compulsory internship at Institute

College: AVS Ayurveda Mahavidyalaya, Bijapur
Eligiblity:
Must have passed the BAMS degree course of a recognised University. Preference will be given to those with interest in teaching & Research.
Should be obtaining Eligibility certificate before admission from Rajiv Ghandhi University of Health Sciences, Bangalore. Application download link-http://www.rguhs.ac.in/forms/elimainform.htm
Only those who have passed the subject concerned (Specialized Subject) at degree level in first attempt eligible for admission.
Shall have obtained not less than 55% in final year degree examination and in the case of ST/SC and in service candidates 50%.
Shall have completed the prescribed period of Internship as on the last date of receipt of application notified by the university.
Shall not have attained the age of 45 years as on the last date fixed for receipt of application. For SC/ST candidates the age limit relaxed up to 48 years
Course_Detail: MD Ayurveda Rasashastra is a three year full time course affiliated by Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences, Bangalore

College: DGM Ayurvedic Medical College and Hospital, Gadag

Students seeking admission to the first year BAMS degree must have passed the two year PUC examination of the PUC Board, Bangalore or any other examination considered equivalent there to by Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences, Bangalore, with Physics, Chemistry and Biology as optionals and with a practical examination in each subject with minimum 50% marks in these subjects
2. A candidate who has passed the Pre-professional examination in Medicine conducted by any other recognized university shall also be eligible for admission. Subjects studied in the occasional course will not be considered.
3. In the case of a candidate who has taken Zoology and Botany as separate subjects, the marks in those subjects at the degree level will be considered as Biology marks.
4. A candidate who fulfils any one of the above requirements must have obtained not less than 50% marks in aggregate in the science subjects (Physics, Chemistry and Biology) at the qualifying examination or at a higher (University) examination.
5. No candidate shall be admitted unless he/she has completed 17 years of age as on 31st Dec. of the year of admission.
6. Students who have passed an examination other than Pre – University, (Bangalore), should submit Eligibility Certificate before admission issued by the Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences, Bangalore
